intro: Macroule balansae, commonly known as the Balansae macroule, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
